tweets.text:
2020 has been a good year for beavers in England! The canals and dams beavers build alleviate flood risk and create wetlands for other species. 

400 years ago they were hunted to extinction, find out about the successes we've seen in their reintroduction: https://t.co/JSWh5o63Kd

urls.title: Why 2020 has been good for England's beavers
urls.description: Homes for these "ultimate environmental engineers" have been set up in enclosures across England.

tweets.text: @DylanAshfordRBX OK SO we dont talk too much, but honestly you're really great guy, you are very reliable and you are so but so interesting, even though we talk rarely, i can see through you and ik that you're better than binny

@shaun_boughton @HS2theTruth @greenarteries @RosieP4 @Jane45665825 @EnvAgencySE @AnglianWater @LV8andrea @chrismothman1 @MarkAlanCory @HomesEngland I've been saying that like a broken record for the last six months but usually met with a deafening silence. Do I sense a stirring somewhere...?

Flood warnings remain in place for some parts of the country, please see the latest guidance from the @EnvAgency. For more information on our safety advice during #flooding, please visit our website: https://t.co/wiaEd75gLj #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/TpbTzd5R6o
The team at Steart Marshes would like to wish you a very Happy New Year and share a few pictures from 2020! https://t.co/1XGAxSCEUG

tweets.text: @HS2theTruth @greenarteries @RosieP4 @Jane45665825 @EnvAgencySE @AnglianWater @LV8andrea @chrismothman1 @Evansthegrump @MarkAlanCory @HomesEngland Given the current situation and the way we have moved to working at home and less public travel they need to revisit this and realise that the world has changed people have. Changed

@Evansthegrump @chrismothman1 @RosieP4 @EnvAgencySE @AnglianWater @LV8andrea @MarkAlanCory How can anyone in @yourcolchester  be pleased with the regeneration of the hythe. I would call it a failure. And now residents have to live with this eyesore. A major if not the most important part of historic Colchester has been neglected

@RosieP4 @EnvAgencySE @AnglianWater @LV8andrea @chrismothman1 @Evansthegrump @MarkAlanCory Exactly the damage is serious and will eventually collapse blocking that discharge tunnel the the sewage plant will face one massive problem . https://t.co/3xuS5J08Ui

@chrismothman1 @RosieP4 @EnvAgencySE @AnglianWater @LV8andrea @Evansthegrump @MarkAlanCory Flooding is occluding all round us infrastructure is failing but the answer to build 9000 should be done once we have adequate infrastructure and a sewage system that‚Äôs working give what‚Äôs happening that sewage plant will be forced to stop releasing what problem will that cause

@greenarteries @RosieP4 @Jane45665825 @shaun_boughton @EnvAgencySE @AnglianWater @LV8andrea @chrismothman1 @Evansthegrump @MarkAlanCory @HomesEngland The question is why does EEH try to pretend rail could ever compete for the journeys that people will want to make from these car-dependent housing locations to other car-dependent locations. It seems Homes England is content to support the illusion. Some call it "planning". https://t.co/Teq4RIfFPL

Today is my last working day at the @EnvAgency after 25 years. Thanks for all the memories and friends I‚Äôve made along the way.

Bring on the new year, new organisation, and new job.

tweets.text:
Bledhen Noweth Da!

Happy New Year One & All

2020 has been a year like no other & I can say with some certainty that 2021 will bring plenty of challenges to us all

Water Safety & Awareness will need to be driven hard next year as the country opens up again - #BeCoastSafe https://t.co/hPQcPVT4fL

@PaulBurrowsy @EnvAgencyAnglia What does the cut off channel do? 
Does it take water from Little Ouse directly to the Relief Channel?
If you are making a New Years Resolution, please make it to check your #floodrisk & sign up for a FREE @EnvAgency flood warning! Go on, it'll only take a few minutes & could save a lot of heartbreak!

tweets.text: The breach in the bank of #SherborneBrook now flowing unabated for a year,forming a new deep channel, scouring pasture of topsoil and felling trees in its path. Weir blocked with debris. This is Grade2 Historic landscape being damaged daily for a year. what to do? @EnvAgency https://t.co/J8gce8n6wf

This is really grim and another example of Sherborne‚Äôs historic Grade 2 listed landscape left to ruin by @nationaltrust. Community very keen to help. @CotswoldsAONB @EnvAgency @EnvAgencySW @GlosLiveOnline https://t.co/TA1oIT7j7c

tweets.text: It was beautiful here today. Had a lovely long walk out with the dog exploring the crisp, muddy, snowy, icy, boggy fields of Woodgate Valley Country Park ‚òÄÔ∏è‚ùÑÔ∏è‚õÑÔ∏èüêæ https://t.co/s8qbvcbMX4

@clivetrue @CliveJFox @EelGroup @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @EU_ENV @EU_MARE @CITES @severnrivers while additional measures are also taken to overcome barriers and restore habitats. Restocking is a quick fit - hoping that the final solution will eventually come through.

@CliveJFox @EelGroup @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @EU_ENV @EU_MARE @CITES @severnrivers @EelGroup are the experts here, but argument is that habitat degradation  / barriers etc mean that Severn/Parrett etc cannot support Ns of glass eels that arrive - so there is a natural surplus that can be used (incl. for stocking)

Congratulations to Sally Gallagher, a groundwater specialist in the North East, who has been recognised with an MBE in the New Year Honours for protecting communities and safeguarding the environment. 

It's very well deserved and we're delighted! 

#NewYear2021 
#MBE https://t.co/4B9uF42D0N
